title: Pixel 3XL microphones making constant white noise and correspondent cannot hear me during voice call
content:
In 2019, I purchased a brand new Pixel 3XL device. It developed battery issues. I asked you to repair my device under warranty, and you told me that you could only send a replacement device, not a repair on the original device. I expressed that I did not want a refurbished device and your agents kept reassuring me that refurbished devices work just like new ones. After multiple refurbished devices with the same issue, now I know it was a lie.

Before the pandemic, I contacted you again, regarding a manufacturer's error with my first refurbished replacement device and you sent me a second replacement device.

The replacement device had the same audio defect. I contacted you, and you sent me a replacement for the replacement.

During the pandemic, I did not have a chance to test the device, nor did I have the means to pay for a replacement or risk exposing myself to COVID-19 by trying to return this device. However, I this replacement for the replacement has the same problem: the microphone makes a constant white noise and my recipient cannot hear me on voice calls. The phone cannot fulfill the original basic function of a phone: make phone calls where recipients talk to each other.

Do you have any Pixel 3XL devices that do not have an audio problem?
